file_content.text: Hey, thanks. I just heard from Lieutenant Treshoda. They said they'll be in touch with me soon.
You just tell Lieutenant Treshoda that I'm worth any price you want from him.
Hey. Hey, there. You got a second?
Ooh. You're one of them Sith Lords. I ain't seen one of those before. Am I supposed to bow or something?
You look like someone important in the Empire, huh?
I bet you could get me to who's in charge.
Why would the Empire have any interest in a little worm like you?
Why would I do that?
I'm part of the resistance. Or was. Was! I mean, it's dead. We've known that since you set our own droids against us.
That seems like a strange request.
What do you want?
I've got no ties to the Empire except what they pay me.
I'm no Imperial.
But you know people, right? I just want to make a trade. The resistance is a lost cause.
You're the first Balmorran I've met who's actually asking to be hauled off.
You want to be arrested?
I don't want to be arrested. I want to trade. The resistance is dead; I know that.
Don't joke with me.
I ain't never been more serious. Once you turned our droids against us, Balmorra was dead. It's just mop-up for you.
I want to come out of this with my head. I got info, right here. Where the rebels are, what they're hitting.
Introduce me to the mucky-mucks and I'll trade 'em the rest for a berth off-planet.
It's possible High Command might be interested.
That has potential.
You bet they would be! Nothing happens in the resistance that Gryffin Remus doesn't know about.
You want to defect?
A trade?
Now you're getting it! Help me out.
I think Lieutenant Treshoda handles defections, but he's been targeted a few times, so he don't take people off the street anymore.
You convince him I'm the real goods, and I bet he'd cut you in a finder's fee.
Beneath me. [Refuse quest]
Okay, okay. I get it. I can do this myself.
The resistance is dead. Ain't no winning now.
